intro: Tupa acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed tupa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Tupa acuminata typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
